intro: Macrolobium inaequale, commonly known as the unequal-lobed senna, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features bipinnate leaves with unequal lobes, giving it its scientific name. Its yellow flowers are typically clustered in racemes, and it produces elongated, flat pods that contain several seeds. Macrolobium inaequale is often found in moist, shaded habitats within its native range.
